description:
Using Nova-Network with use_ipv6 = True creates a problem. If an instance is spawned on a compute-node the br100 is created and the IPv4 routes are moved from the physical interface to the bridge. This does not seem to happen with the IPv6 routes.

I end up with two routes for the same destination. One via the physical device and one via br100. This breaks the functionality until I delete the route that directs to the physical interface. As far as I can see in the linux_net.py#L1553 (stable/Icehouse) the "ip -6 route del" should be run along with ensure_bridge there.

Also the interface should not accept RAs in the future since this would set the default route again.
title: IPv6 routes are not deleted in linux_net.py/ensure_bridge
